articles.author: Howard Schneider, Ann Saphir
articles.description: Federal Reserve policymakers look increasingly likely to end this year with interest rates on hold and begin 2024 mulling the timing of their first cut in borrowing costs as they try to engineer a "soft landing" for the economy.
articles.title: Fed likely done raising interest rates; Waller flags possible cut

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: Amazon (AMZN.O) is trying to lure big corporate customers to it AWS cloud computing service with a new chatbot for businesses, and by offering to guard them against legal and reputational damage that can come from the output of artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Amazon's AWS appeals to corporate customers with new chatbot, AI safety measures

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: A challenge to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's powers to protect investors from fraud comes before the Supreme Court on Wednesday in another in a series of legal attacks against federal agencies that regulate financial markets.
articles.title: SEC's in-house enforcement powers at risk in US Supreme Court case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. consumer confidence rose in November after three straight monthly declines, though households continued to anticipate a recession over the next year, a survey showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: US consumer confidence rises in November

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bank of America (BAC.N) will pay a $12 million penalty for submitting false mortgage lending information to the government, violating a federal law that lenders have routinely followed for decades, the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Bank of America pays $12 mln fine for reporting false mortgage data

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Meta Platforms (META.O), which owns WhatsApp, Instagram and Facebook, said on Tuesday it would appeal a judge's ruling that a U.S. regulator can seek to reduce the amount of money the social media company makes from users under 18.
articles.title: Meta says it will appeal US judge's ruling in privacy fight with FTC

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: OPEC+ talks on oil policy are difficult, making a further delay to a meeting planned for Thursday possible and also making a rollover a possibility, four OPEC+ sources said on Tuesday.
articles.title: OPEC+ talks tough, further delay in meeting or rollover possible, sources say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: An Israel-Hamas truce in Gaza was poised to stretch into a fifth day on Tuesday amid expectations the Islamist group will free more of the hostages it seized on Oct. 7 in return for greater aid flows and Israel's release of imprisoned Palestinians.
articles.title: More Israeli hostages, Palestinians expected to be freed with extended truce

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Indian rescuers on Tuesday pulled out all 41 construction workers trapped for 17 days inside a collapsed tunnel in the Himalayas, hours after drilling through the debris of rock, concrete and earth to reach them.
articles.title: All trapped Indian workers rescued from Himalayan tunnel, say officials

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The wife of Ukraine's military intelligence chief has been poisoned with heavy metals, several Ukrainian media outlets reported on Tuesday, citing unnamed intelligence sources.
articles.title: Ukrainian spy chief's wife poisoned, media reports say
